title: Sex & The City vet Kim Cattrall on the set of her new TV drama Filthy Rich
text:
She recently reiterated that she would not be taking part in a third installment of the Sex And The City movie franchise.

But that doesn't mean Kim Cattrall isn't working all the time. Her latest project is the TV drama Filthy Rich.

On Tuesday the 63-year-old star was spotted on the New Orleans, Louisiana set of the project while wearing an equestrian-style ensemble.

Fashionista: Kim Cattrall rocked a fringe jacket with an equestrian look on Tuesday when she was spotted filming scenes for her upcoming series, Filthy Rich, in New Orleans, Louisiana

Kim rocked a green printed button-up shirt that she left untucked underneath a suede jacket that had a fringe on the sleeves.

She teamed the jacket with form-fitting cropped trousers of the same color.

The actress completed the look with white socks and a pair of slides.

Style: Kim rocked a green printed button-up shirt that she left untucked underneath a suede jacket that had a fringe on the sleeves

Shoot day: Kim's blonde hair was blown out effortlessly over her shoulders and she was seen carrying her script in her hand

Kim's blonde hair was blown out effortlessly over her shoulders and she was seen carrying her script in her hand.

Her makeup was radiant with blushed cheeks, a dark eye and a nude color on her lips.

At one point Kim was seen lifting her arms and pointing at someone from across the location.

Her new project sees her play the role of Margaret Monreaux, 'the Oprah-like host and co-founder of the Sunshine Network, who is determined to control the business by all means necessary.'

She's the boss! Her new project sees her play the role of Margaret Monreaux, 'the Oprah-like host and co-founder of the Sunshine Network, who is determined to control the business by all means necessary'

Filthy Rich sees a very wealthy Southern family collide after Margaret's husband, Eugene, and co-founder of a Christian television network, dies in a plane crash.

The family are then left to divide all assets before they learn in the will that they have three more family members from the founder's various affairs who will also inherit the empire.

The official trailer was released in May 2020 but the show won't debut on FOX until January 2020.

Kim's new role comes as she's continued to stay strong on never again reuniting with her Sex And The City co-stars for a third movie.

'No means no,' she told The Guardian before calling out the 'bullying' she received over her refusal to revisit her character of PR maneater, Samantha Jones.

Not long to go: The official trailer was released in May 2020 but the show won't debut on FOX until January 2020; here she is seen in May

'I went past the finish line playing Samantha Jones because I loved Sex And The City,' she said.

'It was a blessing in so many ways but after the second movie I’d had enough.

'I couldn’t understand why they wouldn’t just replace me with another actress instead of wasting time bullying. No means no.'

Kim also took a swipe at her rival, Sarah Jessica Parker, earlier in the year, stating she only she wants to work with 'good people'.

Speaking with Mail Online, the beauty made light of her ongoing feud, even hinting the 54-year-old wasn't a 'good person'.

When asked if there was any chance she'd appear in another SATC movie, she replied: 'Never. It's a no from me', without any hesitation.

'No means no': Kim's new role comes as she's continued to stay strong on never again reuniting with her Sex and the City co-stars for a third movie (pictured in 1997 with Cynthia Nixon, Kristin Davis and Sarah Jessica Parker)

'You learn lessons in life and my lesson is to do work with good people and try and make it fun.'

While rumors of a feud have swirled for years, the depth of Kim and Sarah's strained friendship came to light after the the grief-stricken 62-year-old slammed the Carrie Bradshaw star's Tweet after her brother's death.

'You are not my family. You are not my friend. So I'm writing to tell you one last time to stop exploiting our tragedy in order to restore your "nice girl" persona,' Kim wrote.

It came after Sarah had written: 'Dearest Kim, my love and condolences to you and yours and Godspeed to your beloved brother. Xx,' underneath her announcement of brother Chris' death.
